title: Power - effect of mass on speed

content.question: A motor delivers a constant power <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math> to a toy car of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> on a straight, level track. The car starts from rest and after a time <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math>, the car has speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>. If the same motor delivers the same power to another car of mass <math alttext="2 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></math>, what will the car’s speed be after a time <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction v over the square root of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>v</mi><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the sqaure root of 2, end root, times v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><mi>v</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction v over the square root of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>v</mi><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
